com: Stirling hits the ball in the air towards cover point, just couldn't get on top of the ball. Ends up hitting it straight into the fielder's hands. First wicket gone.

Another wicket goes down! Its the flipper from Zampa and Porterfield looks to pull the ball into the legside. It keeps low and hits him in front of the stumps. Porterfield knew that he was gone and didn't even need to look at the umpire. Head down and kept walking back

Anderson stays in the crease again and looks to turn the ball into the off-side. Gets hit on the pad and the umpire's finger goes up. Anderson reviews the decision. No bat on the ball and it does look a touch high. It bounces in line and it's just clipping the top of the bails. It's the umpire's call and Anderson has to go

another Wicket goes down! Wilson looks to run the ball down to third man and gets a thin edge through to the keeper. Wade takes the catch and throws the ball up in the air. Ireland in a bit of trouble here now!

What's happened here? Terry gets hit on the pads and Worrell goes up for the LBW. Terry wanders out of the crease and the ball gets thrown back in from slip and Terry is run out. Quick thinking there from Smith that leaves Ireland in even bigger trouble now. Terry is gone for a duck
got him! It's a good length ball and Poynter is looking to play off the back foot. It comes back in off the pitch and takes out the off-stump. There was no foot movement from Poynter and he has to go
Zampa bowls him, it's the googly from Zampa and the ball turns back in a long way. Dockrell moved to the legside and tried to cut the ball. He misses and Zampa hits

Big Wicket for Australia! Zampa bowls the ball out of the back of the hand and O'Brien is looking to edge it past the keeper. The wrong'un turns more than he expects and gets hit on the back pad. The umpire is in no doubt and O'Brien has to go!
McCarthy gets a ball in the arc and swings at the ball, it goes high in the air and Bailey gets under the ball at point and takes a comfortable catch
the batsmen had crossed whilst the ball was in the air and so Murtagh was on strike. He chips a ball from outside off into Bailey's hands at backward point. Tame end to the innings
